newsitem.title: UK: UKs Blair ready to remove whip from MP if charged.
newsitem.headline: UKs Blair ready to remove whip from MP if charged.

text.p: Prime Minister Tony Blair said on Wednesday he was prepared to remove the Labour Party whip from Glasgow MP Mohammad Sarwar if police charge him with an election offence.
Sarwar has admitted giving a 5,000 stg loan after the election to Badar Islam, who stood against him in Govan as an Independent Labour candidate.
He is pursuing legal action against the News of the World newspaper for alleging that the money was given to Badar as a bribe.
The Blair aide said Labour's National Executive would set up a three-person committee to look into the affair.
"Whether or not there are police charges and convictions, if there is any impropriety of any sort found by us, there will be disciplinary action," the aide said.
He said such action could be as serious as barring Sarwar from standing as a Labour candidate again. -- London Newsroom +44 171 5427767
